alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Broward County through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, or 14 miles northwest of Sunrise, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal and Markham Park. LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County
